abstract: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell and Minority Leader Harry Reid have long had poor relationship that has led to difficulty, but gridlock in chamber has worsened in new session; McConnell's central role, getting bipartisan consensus and keeping flow of legislation moving, has been impeded by internal struggles in Republican Party and hostility from Democrats.
lead_paragraph: Senator Mitch McConnell, the majority leader, has been impeded by internal struggles in his party and the hostility that awaits him across the aisle.

headline.main: Mitch McConnell Makes Changes, but Senate Gridlock Remains
headline.print_headline: Majority Leader Brings Changes, but Gridlock Remains in the Senate

snippet: Senator Mitch McConnell, the majority leader, has been impeded by internal struggles in his party and the hostility that awaits him across the aisle.
